intro: Nardosmia billingsiana, commonly known as the sweet fern or sweet grass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and emit a pleasant, spicy fragrance when crushed. Nardosmia billingsiana is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodlands.
